thread.title: I will not give up on my dream
thread.title_full: I will not give up on my dream | News24

author: news24.com
title: I will not give up on my dream
text:
I am a 30 year old currently employed and a student at UNISA. In 2002 I matriculated with an exemption, applied at Rhodes and RAU Universities but was unable to afford the admission fee. Both my parents were unemployed and both my older sisters never went to tertiary.
I was heartbroken and distraught as I knew and understood that my family can only escape the chains of poverty if one of my siblings went to university. I looked for a job and was fortunate to be employed at a retail store for casual work that paid me R6.50 p/h.
I could never be guaranteed how much I would receive as my days were not stable. So I looked for another job, with the hope of one day being able to fund my education, and worked as a street marketer.
As a street marketer you get paid daily from the door to door sales money you made. If you don’t sell, you don’t earn. Yet, I found myself unable to save as I was a bread winner at home. Letsema 1 was introduced and I applied and attended interviews.
